title: XPO Logistics Explores Strategic Alternatives for Business Units
summary: Company hires financial advisers as it shifts from buyer to seller in freight logistics market. XPO Logistics Inc. is exploring the possible sale or spinoff of one or more of its business units, in a sharp reversal from the company's rapid rise through acquisitions to the top ranks of logistics operators.

title: Iraq's Caretaker Prime Minister Leaves Decision Whether to Expel U.S. Troops to Successor
summary: U.S. has rebuffed calls by the prime minister to send delegates to make preparations for a withdrawal, questioning his authority. BAGHDAD-Iraq's caretaker Prime Minister Adel Abdul-Mahdi indicated he would leave a decision whether to expel U.S. forces from the country to his successor, potentially slowing a push that could trigger American military-aid cuts and sanctions.

title: FBI's Proposed Surveillance Changes Fall Short, Says Review
summary: Former Justice Department official Davis Kris says FBI must set better top-to-bottom tone on accuracy. WASHINGTON-Federal Bureau of Investigation proposals to address failures in its secret surveillance applications are insufficient and potentially obscure larger cultural changes the agency needs to make, according to a former Justice Department official named to review the plans.

title: Weakening Dollar Could Lift Commodities in 2020
summary: With the greenback forecast to decline further, commodities are set to look more attractive to overseas buyers. A softening U.S. dollar could give commodity prices a boost this year.

title: Rise in Check Fraud Could Motivate Switch to Other Payment Tools
summary: Bank checks are still the most popular method for business-to-business payments in the U.S., the Association for Finance Professionals says. A recent rise in check fraud could motivate corporate treasurers to ditch paper checks and replace them with faster, safer and cheaper electronic payments.

title: McClatchy Misses Debt and Pension Payments
summary: Newspaper publisher is working on debt-equity swap deal, government takeover of pension fund. McClatchy Co. , the second-largest newspaper publisher in the U.S. by circulation, skipped a $12 million debt-interest payment due Wednesday as it continues to negotiate with creditors to avoid a bankruptcy-court proceeding.

title: Antitrust Chief Signals Skepticism of NCAA in Pay Fight
summary: Top Justice Department official scrutinizing association's responses in national dispute over player compensation. The National Collegiate Athletic Association is facing an additional source of pressure as it considers lifting some restrictions on the payment of college athletes, this time from within the Trump administration.

title: Avenatti Ordered Jailed Until Trial
summary: A federal judge ordered U.S. marshals to transport Mr. Avenatti to New York to where he faces trial next week. A federal judge in California ordered celebrity attorney Michael Avenatti jailed until his trial in that state, after prosecutors accused him of committing a ream of financial crimes while free on bond.

title: Germany Probes Alleged Chinese Spy Ring
summary: Prosecutors say they suspect three German nationals passed sensitive information such as company data to Chinese handlers. BERLIN-German prosecutors have launched an international investigation into a suspected Chinese spy ring centering on three German nationals, including a former senior diplomat.

title: Barclays, FactSet Offer New Tool to Navigate Opaque Bond Market
summary: Bank's way to measure liquidity will be available to subscribers of the data provider. Barclays PLC and data provider FactSet are teaming up to bolster transparency in the opaque bond markets.

title: Harrah's Casino in Reno to Be Sold, Closed After 82 Years
summary: Caesars Entertainment Corp. said it would sell the site to a real-estate developer for $50 million. Harrah's Reno Hotel and Casino will close after Caesars Entertainment Corp. said it agreed to sell the property for $50 million to a real-estate developer, which will turn it into a nongambling resort. The change of business plan highlights the growing challenges facing traditional gambling operators.

title: IT Spending on Track to Hit $3.9 Trillion in 2020, Gartner Says
summary: Enterprise software will be the fastest-growing market segment, climbing 10.5% to $503 billion. Global spending on information technology is expected to reach $3.9 trillion in the year ahead, up 3.4% from 2019, as companies ward off political and economic uncertainties by investing in cloud software aimed at cutting costs, research firm Gartner Inc. says.

title: Virginia Governor Bans Guns From Capitol Grounds Ahead of Rally
summary: Northam says threats include armed militias and weaponized drones. Virginia Gov. Ralph Northam temporarily banned firearms from the grounds of the state Capitol in Richmond, citing law-enforcement concerns about weaponized drones and armed militias storming the statehouse during a pro-gun rally planned for Monday.

title: NYCHA Records Fewer Heating Outages at Developments
summary: Public-housing residents testify at a hearing that they have noticed improvements since housing authority began focusing on heat repairs. Heating outages at New York City's public housing developments have decreased since the city began a federally mandated maintenance plan, officials said Wednesday at a City Council hearing.

summary: CEOs and state officials crowd courtroom to hear final arguments; Wall Street frets over Sprint's standalone prospects. title: Warren, Sanders Spat Sparks Female Electability Debate
summary: The presidential campaign has been marked by worries that a woman would face a disadvantage in taking on the president in the November election. WASHINGTON-The rift between Elizabeth Warren and Bernie Sanders has exposed a long-simmering frustration among Democratic women: A sense that female candidates have been sidelined because voters think a man is more likely to defeat President Trump.

title: Businessman Convicted in Insider-Trading Trial
summary: Prosecutors alleged Telemaque Lavidas was part of international ring that made tens of millions of dollars in illicit profits. title: Concerns About Cloud Security Prompt More Scrutiny from Financial Regulators

title: Fed's Kaplan Warns Central Bank Actions Are Driving Up Risk Taking
summary: The Dallas Fed leader would like to find a way soon to pare back the expansion of the Fed's balance sheet.. title: Doesn't Anybody Want To Be President?
summary: In the last Democratic debate before voting begins, candidates come up small.. Six competitors took the stage at Tuesday's Democratic presidential debate at Iowa's Drake University. But nobody wanted to compete. Given a final opportunity to challenge rivals before Democrats begin selecting the party's nominee, the candidates looked just as bored as the television viewers who were treated to stale recitations of campaign talking points. The reasonable conclusion is that both of America's major political parties will be relying on Donald Trump to drive turnout in November.

title: Physician Burnout Is Widespread, Especially Among Those in Midcareer
summary: About half of doctors surveyed would take a big pay cut to aid work-life balance, report says. Physicians between the ages of 40 and 54 experience a higher rate of burnout than older or younger doctors, according to a recent survey of more than 15,000 physicians who cited administrative tasks and work hours as key drivers of their stress.

title: Florida to Buy Everglades Parcel to Save It From Oil Drilling
summary: Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis has made wetlands restoration a central element of his environmental agenda. Florida struck a deal to buy an expanse of land in the Everglades that will halt a plan to drill for oil that stirred outrage among conservationists.

title: Is LinkedIn a Waste of Time?
summary: Professional platform might fail as a social-media diversion, but experts argue that it's still a career builder. Here's the smart way to use it. title: Environmental Risks Loom Large Among Economic Forum Members
summary: Ahead of Davos meeting, report shows climate change is increasingly unsettling government, academic and business leaders. LONDON-Environmental risks have jumped to the top of the concerns of government, academic and business leaders over a 10-year horizon as the effects of climate change have struck harder and more rapidly than many expected, according to a report from the World Economic Forum ahead of its annual meeting next week in Davos, Switzerland.

title: Stubborn German Slowdown Ominous for European Economy
summary: Country's manufacturers are tightly integrated in the continent. FRANKFURT-Germany's economic growth slumped to a six-year low in 2019 as the export powerhouse faced challenges in its flagship car industry, persistently slowing Chinese growth and global trade conflicts, a slowdown that weighs on Europe's outlook.

title: Buttigieg's Campaign Cybersecurity Chief Resigns
summary: His was the sole Democratic presidential campaign known to have a full-time cyber staffer. The cybersecurity chief for Democratic candidate for president Pete Buttigieg's campaign has resigned, amid warnings from intelligence officials and cybersecurity experts that presidential campaigns face challenges in thwarting cyberattacks and disinformation campaigns.

title: 'Modus Vivendi' by 070 Shake Review: A Newcomer's Song Cycle About Heartbreak
summary: Danielle Balbuena, who goes by the alias 070 Shake and first came to attention on Kanye West's 2018 'Ye,' releases a debut that tackles desire, loneliness and anger.. In June 2018 Kanye West released "Ye," his eighth studio album and easily the weakest record of his career. Amid the clunky rhymes and slapdash production is a song called "Ghost Town," which features what may be the record's only transcendent moment. Following a half-sung verse by Mr. West over a gospel sample, a woman's voice, both deep and soaring, cuts through the clutter. She wails about putting her hand on a hot stove to remind herself that she still feels something, and then, as the chorus reaches its resolution, she sings of transcending pain. It was the kind of striking guest feature that sends people Googling to see who this unfamiliar vocalist might be.

title: Fed's Beige Book Reports Continued Modest Growth

summary: Some of the trade war's aims were accomplished, but many weren't. Two years, innumerable late-night tweets and reams of newspaper articles later, the U.S.-China trade battle royale of 2018 and 2019 is winding down. A few of its purported aims were accomplished. Many weren't.

title: Trump and the Support of Evangelical Voters
summary: Many, if not most, evangelicals prefer not to have a voice in what Eric Metaxas calls "The Christian Case for Trump" because they don't believe there is a clear "Christian" case for or against President Trump.. Many, if not most, evangelicals prefer not to have a voice in what Eric Metaxas calls "The Christian Case for Trump" (op-ed, Jan. 8) because they don't believe there is a clear "Christian" case for or against the president. They dislike his brash behavior but are equally turned off by the hatred the left has for him and its ridicule of evangelicals' concerns and beliefs. They have doubts about President Trump's Christianity, but that judgment belongs to the Lord. "The world is not their home" and they have little faith in government institutions, political parties or the press. But they do believe in the providence of God. The Bible is full of cases where God has used flawed, even evil, men to accomplish his purpose.

title: Stretching Out Depreciation Is Bad for Jobs
summary: Sen. Elizabeth Warren seems to have learned nothing from history given her idea of lengthening the amortization/depreciation period for industrial equipment.. Sen. Elizabeth Warren seems to have learned nothing from history given her idea of lengthening the amortization/depreciation period for industrial equipment, though this wasn't mentioned in your editorial "Elizabeth Warren Has a Plan, Oh My" (Dec. 27). I'm a former CEO and president of a tier-one automotive supplier, and I encouraged Congress to shorten the depreciation time. Around 50 years ago, depreciation averaged 10 years. The major automotive companies were the only companies that could afford to purchase new equipment. They received a tax saving each year during the depreciation time of their equipment. When there was no tax saving left, companies purchased a new machine. Their 10-year old machinery was put on the market and purchased by tier-one suppliers. After depreciating the machines for 10 years and not getting an additional tax savings, the tier-one suppliers would place their old machinery on the market and purchase "new" machinery from the big three. Tier-two suppliers would then purchase 20-year-old machines from the tier-one suppliers for their use. The result was that many of the parts made for the auto industry were produced on 30-year-old, obsolete machinery.

title: Out-of Pocket Costs More Important Than Drug Rise
summary: The real issue is rising patient out-of-pocket costs owing to insufficient benefit design.. While the article "Drug Prices Climb By 5.8%" (Page One, Jan. 3) points to the complexities behind pharmaceutical drug pricing, the real issue is rising patient out-of-pocket costs owing to insufficient benefit design.

title: The Violence of Chilean Left And Nostalgia for Pinochet
summary: Wanton violence by the left: Exactly what Gen. Augusto Pinochet saved Chile from in 1973.. Regarding Jack Benjamin's letter ("Chile's Inequality Problem Is Deeply Seated," Jan. 9) responding to Axel Kaiser's "Latin America's 'Oasis' Descends Into Chaos" (op-ed, Jan. 2) which cites October's "wanton violence": 80 subway stations in Santiago destroyed, 1,200 looted retail stores, 2,000 injured police officers, 25 dead and more than $2 billion in losses. All that was a result of coordinated action by the Chilean left-exactly what Gen. Augusto Pinochet saved Chile from in 1973. I am sure many people in Chile miss him now.

title: A Boundary-Busting Artist Seeks to 'Learn Through the Chaos'
summary: Resume Subscription. The art world tends to reward up-and-comers who create singular bodies of work that are easy to identify-and therefore sell-but Florida-born artist Vaughn Spann is poised to become the season's breakout star by taking the opposite approach.

title: Are Shearling-Lined Shoes Too Toasty?
summary: We road-test the new breed of fuzzy men's shoes. Though they're more sophisticated than Uggs, we had questions. IN 2000, Oprah Winfrey changed the course of footwear history by including Ugg shearling boots on her annual list of "Favorite Things." While women sought out the cozy boots with undisguised mania, men enthused about them more cautiously (quarterback Tom Brady and rapper Lil Wayne have featured in the brand's ads, and celebrities like Leonardo DiCaprio have worn the fuzzy shoes). Twenty years since Oprah's fateful endorsement, the shearling-shoe category has expanded beyond Uggs with their "celebrity taking out the garbage" vibe to include more refined iterations.

title: 2019 Was Second-Warmest Year on Record
summary: Ten of the warmest years in their records occurred in the past decade, NOAA and NASA say. The world experienced near-record global temperatures in 2019, federal climate scientists said. The year capped what the scientists said was the warmest decade in modern times.

summary: Banks sought far less than the $120 billion the Fed was willing to offer. The Federal Reserve Bank of New York added $47.5 billion to financial markets Wednesday.

title: Cyclists are Shifting This Spanish City's Real-Estate Market Into High Gear
summary: An influx of bike enthusiasts is driving the development of rental properties in Girona, which saw property sales prices rise 15% year-to-year. The Israeli property developer, amateur cyclist and triathlete immediately took to the historical Catalan town's weather, its pristine roadways, the people, the food and its relaxed atmosphere. summary: U.S. Treasury urges Switzerland to cut taxes and spur investment. The Swiss franc climbed to a multiyear high after Switzerland was added to the U.S. Treasury's watch list of currency manipulators earlier this week.

summary: Resume Subscription. When Millicent Safro was shutting down her Upper East Side shop Tender Buttons last summer, she did so thinking she might find a new location for the half-century-old sewing-supply emporium that specialized in its namesake product.

title: Billie Jean King on How Silence Helps Her Game
summary: "When I played Bobby Riggs in the Battle of the Sexes a thousand years ago, I would also visualize and be very quiet. I pictured getting every ball, hitting every overhead, making him run.". "Silence helps me visualize how I want the world to look. I want inclusion, and men are really important to this. Women still aren't paid enough. Girls often don't have proper leagues. The old-boy network is as strong as ever. People come up to me and say, 'Thank you for what you did for women's tennis.' But I fought for tennis; I didn't fight just for women. They would never go up to a male and say, 'Thanks for what you did for men's tennis'-ever. When I played Bobby Riggs in the Battle of the Sexes a thousand years ago, I would also visualize and be very quiet. I pictured getting every ball, hitting every overhead, making him run-just doing everything right. It's important to be silent each day of your life to meditate and reflect, because a lot of creativity comes from it. Silence keeps you centered."

title: Austin Getaway: A Grown-Up's Guide to the Cool-Kid City
summary: The city famed for its slackers and scruffy charm has acquired new sophistication, without losing its quirkiness and acres of food trucks. AUSTIN IS America's fastest-growing metro area-a hub of technology and innovation with enough college-educated earners to make a San Francisco real-estate agent swoon. In recent years, an average of 100 émigrés a day has been arriving from places like California, Oregon and other Texas towns. The downtown is crammed with condos and worthy coffee shops. Construction workers are busily building six new skyscrapers, one of which will be occupied by Google, and eight more are due. In today's rapidly automating economy, Austin is where it's at.

title: The Idiosyncratic Work of Sculptor Alma Allen
summary: From a new base in Mexico, the artist has created ever larger examples of the charged, abstract sculpture he's become known for-some of which go on view in New York this winter.. Alma Allen learned to drive in rural Utah, where he grew up, and he drives fast. On an average day, he can make the 50-mile trip from his home in Mexico City to his sculpture studio, a boxy warehouse complex near the valley town of Tepoztlán, in about an hour. But the trips he prefers are the longer ones, to check out Mayan ruins or distant stone quarries. "You get used to watching the cuts of the roads-you can see what the ground is from that," he says. "I'm always on the lookout for stones." Near the former silver-mining town of Taxco, he spotted black marble in the roadcut and circled back to a local quarry with an assistant. Two years into his life in Mexico, Allen, 49, has made the most of its indigenous materials-marble, onyx and volcanic basalt, among others-to produce ever larger examples of the charged, abstract sculpture he's become known for. "So much is here. I could spend a lifetime with it," he says.

title: Japanese Men Are Taking Baby Steps Toward Paternity Leave

title: Investors Cash In at China's ATM
summary: Meituan Dianping has taken Baidu's place in a list of China's three top internet companies. Wall Street acronyms tend to be coined because they sound catchy, not because they follow any rigorous logic. FANG, which stands for Facebook , Amazon.com , Netflix and Google, is easy to remember, though there is no good reason why Apple or Microsoft shouldn't be included.

title: Lexington Raises Record $14 Billion for Private Equity Secondary Fund
summary: The New York firm's ninth fund exceeded a $12 billion fundraising target. Lexington Partners has raised the largest fund ever for investments in secondhand private-equity stakes.

title: Aluminum Maker Rings in China's First Dollar Default of 2020
summary: S&P downgrades state-owned company after missed interest payment, saying it lacks resources to repay debt. An aluminum maker with a history of delayed debt payments became the first Chinese company to default on dollar bonds this year, S&P Global Ratings said.

title: The Key Decision Awaiting Boeing's New CEO
summary: Indecision about building a midrange plane has allowed rival plane maker Airbus to eat away at a key market segment. The 737 MAX crisis showed up the shortcomings of Boeing 's management in playing defense. Going into 2020, though, newly appointed Chief Executive David Calhoun will also need to prove he can play attack.

title: Companies Shell Out More in Audit Fees to Tackle Accounting Rule Changes
summary: Average hourly fees to external auditors climbed 31% over the past decade, survey says. Annual audit fees continue to rise for U.S. companies as they adapt to an onslaught of new accounting rules and regulatory changes.

title: Developers Court Wealthy Renters With More Luxury Apartments
summary: New rental completion hits three-decade high, as for-sale home prices continue to climb. Builders are on track to finish more new apartments in 2020 than in any year since the 1980s, a new study shows, with developers across the U.S. chasing after the more affluent tenants.

title: India to Ease Some Internet Restrictions in Kashmir
summary: Authorities said they would review the security situation after a week and decide whether to restore mobile internet services. NEW DELHI-India said it would reinstate some internet access this week to millions of residents of the Kashmir Valley, but will continue to block mobile internet service and social-media sites as the government faces a continued backlash over its decision last year to end the special status of the Muslim-majority region.

title: Former Commerce Secretary Penny Pritzker Endorses Joe Biden
summary: Ms. Pritzker was national finance chair for Barack Obama's campaign in 2008. WASHINGTON-Former U.S. Commerce Secretary Penny Pritzker is endorsing Joe Biden's presidential bid, adding a top donor to the former vice president's campaign ahead of voting contests in Iowa and New Hampshire.

title: Stocks to Watch: Amazon, FedEx, Microsoft, Comcast
summary: Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively Wednesday. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Wednesday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours.

title: Australia Rain Forecast Brings Hope of Fire Relief-and Threat to Water Supply
summary: Authorities in Sydney have placed silt curtains and booms to stop ash and other debris from getting into the city's water system. SYDNEY-Forecasters expect heavy rain in parts of Australia's fire-ravaged southeast in the coming days, offering relief to firefighters, but raising worries that harmful ash could be washed into rivers and contaminate the country's water supply.

title: Democrats Face Off on Foreign Policy in Iowa Debate
summary: Hopefuls in race for White House also clash over health policy and trade. Six Democratic candidates for president differed over leaving troops in the Middle East, while criticizing President Trump's foreign policy, in the final debate before the Iowa caucuses next month.

title: Bios of Seven Democratic Impeachment Managers
summary: House Speaker Pelosi says she chose the lawmakers with an emphasis on litigation and courtroom experience. WASHINGTON-House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Wednesday named a diverse group of seven lawmakers to present the House's case for the removal of President Trump in the coming Senate impeachment trial.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: The Best and Worst U.S. Airlines of 2019
summary: Delta outpaced the field for the third year in a row, while American and United didn't fare nearly so well. Flight cancellations increased. So did long delays, bumping ticketed passengers and consumer complaints.

title: Target Says Holiday Sales Disappointed on Weak Toy Results
summary: Chain cites weakness in toys, electronics; government data on retail sales due out soon. Holiday sales were sluggish at Target Corp. , raising questions about the health of the U.S. consumer and whether the retailer's turnaround is losing steam.

title: New Documents From Giuliani Associate Submitted for Impeachment
summary: Giuliani asked to meet Ukrainian leader with Trump's 'knowledge and consent'; texts indicate tracking of ambassador. New documents in the impeachment probe into President Trump show that his personal lawyer, Rudy Giuliani, asked for a meeting with the Ukrainian president with Mr. Trump's "knowledge and consent" and that one of Mr. Giuliani's associates was sent text messages about tracking the U.S. ambassador's movements in the country.

title: Photos: Six Democratic Candidates Debate in Iowa
summary: Presidential contenders faced off in Des Moines in the last debate before the Iowa caucuses. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Ex-National Security Adviser Seeks to Withdraw Guilty Plea
summary: Court filing accuses government of breaching its 2017 agreement. WASHINGTON-Lawyers representing former national security adviser Michael Flynn asked a federal judge to allow him to withdraw his guilty plea on a single charge of lying to the FBI, in an unusual last-ditch effort to go to trial rather than be sentenced.

title: Trump Uses Campaign Rally to Wade Into Democratic Debate
summary: The president told supporters in Milwaukee that Bernie Sanders was 'surging' and that Democrats were 'wasting their time' with impeachment. MILWAUKEE-As six Democratic candidates faced off in Iowa on Tuesday evening, President Trump, less than 400 miles away, sought to insert himself into the process at a rally for his reelection campaign.

title: NBCUniversal Executive George Cheeks Heading to CBS
summary: George Cheeks to join the newly merged company in a senior role. George Cheeks, a top executive at Comcast Corp.'s NBCUniversal, is headed to ViacomCBS Inc. in a senior role at CBS, where he could ultimately succeed Joe Ianniello as head of the network, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Red Sox Fire Alex Cora Over Role in Sign-Stealing Scandal
summary: The move comes amid an ongoing MLB investigation into cheating by the Red Sox and Cora. When Major League Baseball Commissioner Rob Manfred released his report on the sign-stealing scandal ravaging the sport on Monday, one person received a stay of execution: Boston Red Sox manager Alex Cora.

title: Microsoft Releases Patch to Windows Flaw Found by NSA
summary: Software maker, U.S. agency say they haven't found evidence vulnerability was exploited maliciously. WASHINGTON- Microsoft Corp. released a patch to fix a software vulnerability in its Windows operating system that could allow hackers to breach or surveil targeted computer networks, after the National Security Agency detected the flaw.

title: As Justice Department Pressures Apple, Experts Say iPhone Easier to Crack
summary: Security experts question necessity of latest battle over encryption as new tools emerge. The escalation of a long-running encryption conflict between the Justice Department and Apple Inc. has puzzled security experts who say that new hacking tools have made it possible to gain access to many of the company's devices in criminal investigations.

title: Hedge Funds Could Make One Potential Fed Repo-Market Fix Hard to Stomach
summary: Federal Reserve officials are considering a new tool to ease stresses in the repo market. One hurdle to a possible fix for recent volatility in the short-term cash markets: hedge funds.

title: U.S. Looks at Cuts to Military Aid to Iraq if Troops Are Asked to Leave
summary: State Department, Pentagon prepare options for $250 million in reductions of funds approved by Congress if government follows through on threats to evict 5,300 forces. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration is preparing possible cuts of $250 million in military aid to Iraq, funds already approved by Congress, if the government expels U.S. troops, and is reconsidering a broad spectrum of other economic and military assistance that isn't yet committed.

title: Senate Impeachment Trial Likely to Start Next Tuesday, McConnell Says
summary: House is set to vote Wednesday on the managers of the trial. WASHINGTON-Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said he expects to start the impeachment trial of President Trump next Tuesday, after the House votes on Wednesday to name the Democrats who will argue the case for Mr. Trump's removal and to send the case over to the Senate.

title: Amazon Publishes Books by Top Authors, and Rivals Fret
summary: Dean Koontz, Patricia Cornwell are among the blue-chip writers whose books the tech giant is not just selling but publishing. When Dean Koontz's book contract expired last year, his stature as one of the country's top-selling authors made him a hot target for several major publishing houses. He chose Amazon.com Inc.

title: Australia Fires Push Some Species to the Brink of Extinction
summary: Resume Subscription. Australia's bush fires are threatening the country's unique wildlife-from koalas to native birds to bees-and researchers fear that some species are being pushed to the brink of extinction.

title: Delta Flight Dumps Fuel Above Los Angeles Schools
summary: Some 60 students and adults were treated for minor complaints after plane dropped fuel and turned back to airport. Students and adults at a half-dozen schools in the Los Angeles area were treated for exposure to jet fuel dumped by a Delta Air Lines Inc. flight as it turned back to the airport after an engine emergency.

title: Ukraine Airliner Was Hit by a Second Missile Over Iran, New Video Shows
summary: Footage raises new questions about how forthcoming Iranian authorities were after admitting they accidentally downed jet. Surveillance video from Iran circulating on social media Tuesday appears to show two missiles hitting the Ukrainian passenger jet downed over Tehran, fired approximately 30 seconds apart, providing new information about the tragedy that killed 176 people on the plane.

title: Trucker NEMF Wins Approval of Chapter 11 Liquidation Plan
summary: A bankruptcy judge confirmed New England Motor Freight Inc.'s liquidation plan. A bankruptcy judge approved the liquidation plan of New England Motor Freight Inc., marking the end of the road for what was once one of the largest trucking companies in the Northeast.

title: The Case of Bill Barr vs. Apple
summary: The AG is ignoring the important benefits to society of encryption.. The advance of digital technology is creating new ethical challenges across society, and here we go again in the battle between law enforcement and the privacy of encrypted cell phones in a democracy.

title: Double Signoff for the FBI
summary: Barr tightens the rules on opening probes into presidential campaigns.. Attorney General William Barr on Monday announced the Justice Department's first policy change in response to the FBI's mucking around in the 2016 election. Henceforth, both an AG and the FBI director must sign off on any proposed counterintelligence investigation into a presidential campaign. Three cheers for future accountability.

title: A Truce in the Currency War
summary: Trump bows to economic reality on the value of China's yuan.. Washington and Beijing on Wednesday will sign the first official truce in President Trump's trade war with China, and now we also have a truce in the accompanying currency war. The Treasury Department announced Monday it is dropping its designation of Beijing as a "currency manipulator" in another important de-escalation.

title: Europe's Nuclear Moment
summary: Will Germany, France and the U.K. join the U.S. effort against Iran?. For months Iran has been violating the 2015 nuclear deal while promising to comply again if President Trump abandons his "maximum pressure" campaign. Germany, France and the U.K. have criticized Tehran and Washington while trying to save the accord, but on Tuesday the Europeans took a major step toward finally siding with the U.S.

title: Trump Gets No Soleimani Bump
summary: Only a third back the president's Iran policy and 4 in 10 support the general's killing.. The past two decades have exhausted Americans' willingness to accept or even risk extended military action in the Middle East. Whoever takes the oath as president in January 2021 will face a daunting task: building a sustainable Middle East policy on the ruins of U.S. engagement in the region.

title: Two Predictions for 2020
summary: Students make the case for a contested Democratic convention and a breakthrough for online education.. Editor's note: This Future View is about the surprises the next year might bring. Next week we'll focus on the comment Bernie Sanders reportedly made to Elizabeth Warren that a woman can't win the 2020 presidential election. Putting aside what exactly Mr. Sanders said, we'll ask, "Can a woman win in 2020? Why or why not?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Jan. 21. The best responses will be published that night.

title: Trump Needn't Bang His Head Against the Wall
summary: The border doesn't have to be a fortress to hold back illegal immigration and the numbers prove it.. The conservative commentator Ann Coulter likes to rib President Trump for his administration's glacial progress on walling off the border with Mexico. "Today's border wall construction update," she tweeted the other day. "Miles completed yesterday-zero; miles completed since inauguration-2.5."

title: Boeing Emails Explain Nothing
summary: Where were the acerbic, scathing employees when MCAS was designed?. The latest crop of Boeing emails is a torment to the company in its struggle to get the 737 MAX into the air, but a secret that should not be a secret is that all of corporate America, not just Boeing, lives these days by employing creative, freethinking people who spout off acerbically, critically and colorfully in electronic messages.
